results.title: Acne...it's not your fault
results.brief_description: Outlines the various types of acne suffered by adolescents ranging from a few spots to severe inflamation and indicates the treatment required for each of these stages of acne severity. Stresses that bad acne needs treatment by a medical practitioner.

results.title: If it's easy, it's too easy
results.brief_description: Designed for those who work with sheep. Suggest that many of the accidents that people have while working wiht sheep can be avoided by careful planning or with the assistance of mechanical aids. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Making of 'Raiders of the lost ark'
results.brief_description: Using many extracts from the film “Raiders of the lost ark”, and selections from seventy hours of production footage, this documentary covers key aspects of the production of the film, with special emphasis on Spielberg’s use of storyboards in conferences with his art and set designers, performers and crew. Includes interviews with stars Harrison Ford and Karen Allen, Spielberg and stuntman Harry Leonard. Phtographed and edited by Phillip Schuman and narrated by Scott Beach. Suitable for Years 7-12.

Includes interviews with stars Harrison Ford and Karen Allen, Spielberg and stuntman Harry Leonard. Phtographed and edited by Phillip Schuman and narrated by Scott Beach. Suitable for Years 7-12.

results.title: A New approach to dental health
results.brief_description: Shows a multidisciplinary approach to the teaching of dental care in some English schools. Illustrates how reading, writing, mathematical and social skills, as well as knowledge of dental care, can be developed with this approach. Also notes parents’ reactions to this style of teaching.

results.title: Four views on landscape
results.brief_description: This film prvides an animated reconstruction of some of the major works of Constable, Turner, Van Gogh and Monet. The simple level of the animation and screen text make it suitable for use at primary level.

results.title: People of the ponds
results.creator_credit: Noel Monkman, Australian Educational Films and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: Another of the Australian educational short films directed and photographed by Noel Monkman using the facilities of the Efftee Studios. This film features the microscopic life in a rock pool of an extinct Queensland volcano. Narration by Frank Thring.

results.title: Catching crocodiles
results.creator_credit: Noel Monkman and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film, showing aspects of the life of crocodile hunters on the Gulf of Carpentaria, was one of eleven short Australian educational films produced by Efftee Studios as a result of a partnership between naturalist Noel Monkman and Frank Thring Snr. Monkman photographed and directed the films and Frank Thring Snr narrated most of them. Two series were produced: the “Barrier Reef” series which consisted of five films and the “Australian Marvelogue” series, of which “Catching Crocodiles” is one of six. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Clara Gibbings
results.creator_credit: F.W. Thring and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: This production was adapted from the play of the same name and remained basically a filmed stage play. Dorothy Brunton plays Clara Gibbings, the proprietor of a London pub, who discovers that she is the legitimate but abandoned daughter of the Earl of Dunmoor. She launches herself into high society but soon grows disillusioned and decides to return to the fresh air of her own class. A young aristocrat, Errol, has meanwhile learnt to respect Clara and to see his own decadent life in a new light. Impulsively he proposes marriage and they depart for Australia.

results.title: Harmony Row
results.creator_credit: Frank Thring and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: This production stars George Wallace as a policeman who is assigned to Harmony Row, a notorious haunt of thugs and criminals. On the beat he makes many friends and is finally persuaded to fight Slogger Lee, the biggest trouble maker in Harmony Row, in a boxing tournament.

results.title: Diggers
results.creator_credit: Frank Thring and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: This was the first feature film of the Melbourne enterprise Efftee Films and was adapted for the screen by Pat Hanna from three sketches from his popular Diggers stage show, which featured two Australian cobbers serving in the AIF in France in 1918. The first episode presents the two friends in their attempts to steal rum from a British Army Store; the second episode shows them relaxing in a French cafe while a fellow digger romances with the waitress; the final episode finds the diggers in hospital feigning illness to escape active duty. Cast includes Pat Hanna and George Moon.
